abstract: Responding to a softening commodities market, the mining giant will put several assets into a new metals and mining company, largely undoing the merger of BHP and Billiton in 2001.
snippet: Responding to a softening commodities market, the mining giant will put several assets into a new metals and mining company, largely undoing the merger of BHP and Billiton in 2001.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:40 p.m. | BHP Billiton said on Tuesday that it planned to spin off several assets into a new global metals and mining company, undoing in large part the 2001 merger that created the mining giant ahead of a boom in commodities.

headline.main: BHP Billiton to Spin Off Units, Reversing Consolidation Trend

abstract: A merger frenzy among dollar stores. | BHP Billiton plans to spin off assets into a metals and mining company. | The U.S. tax burden may not be as heavy as it seems. | Bitcoin’s price plunged on Monday to its lowest level since May.
snippet: A merger frenzy among dollar stores. | BHP Billiton plans to spin off assets into a metals and mining company. | The U.S. tax burden may not be as heavy as it seems. | Bitcoin’s price plunged on Monday to its lowest level since May.
lead_paragraph: When Dollar General offered on Monday to buy Family Dollar Stores for $8.9 billion, it was hoping not only to break up Family Dollar’s merger with Dollar Tree but also to strengthen its share of the low-end retail market, Michael J. de la Merced and Nelson D. Schwartz write in DealBook. “Prices at Family Dollar are kept low and its breadth of products is limited to items it can sell cheaply,” they write. “But the retailer’s success has become a symbol of the rush to cater to the working poor.”

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Dollar Store Deal Frenzy

abstract: Prices of nickel and aluminum, assets that will be part of the new company, are rising. But for investors, there are purer plays and better-diversified producers, says Swaha Pattanaik of Reuters Breakingviews.
